name: Google Cloud LAMP stack deployment
description: LAMP - A fully-integrated environment for full stack PHP web development.

metadata.longDescription: Deploys a LAMP Stack (Linux, Apache, MariaDB, PHP) in VMware providing a complete development environment. This deployment also deploys a simple sample application to validate the stack is operational.

bullets.title: Topology
bullets.description:
Google Cloud: 2 virtual machines:
  • Apache and PHP;
  • MariaDB

bullets.title: Software deployed
bullets.description:
1. Apache: a secure, efficient and extensible open-source HTTP server
  2. MariaDB: an open source software as a relational database providing an SQL interface for accessing data.
  3. PHP: a server-side scripting language designed for web development

bullets.title: Default virtual machine settings
bullets.description:
• Google Cloud:
    • Flavor:
      • MariaDB:
        • Cores - 1
        • Memory - 1GB
        • Storage - Depends on Image
      • Front end:
        • Cores - 1
        • Memory - 1GB
        • Storage - Depends on Image
    • Network:
      • Private IP:
        • Availability - Customer Provided
        • Ingress - Via VPN
        • Egress - Not required
      • Public IP:
        • Availability - None
    • Firewall:
      • MariaDB:
        • Ingress - Allows SSH, and TCP 3306 from all sources
        • Egress - All
      • Front end:
        • Ingress - Allows SSH, and HTTP from all sources
        • Egress - All

bullets.title: Usage and special notes
bullets.description: 1. The template expects a firewall rule in GCE that allows access through port 80 (HTTP) on guest VMs that have the tag http-server
